results.title: Yorkshire sands
results.creator_credit: Tony Thompson and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Light verse and gay music make their own comment on the holiday makers of the Yorkshire coastline. Between Tees and Humber thousands each year enjoy the sea and the ands, the funfair, and the ballroom; for a row or a romance, there’s something for each.

results.title: York Cathedral
results.brief_description: A study of York Minister, famous for its XIV century west front, its solemn and impressive nave, lofty choir, and beautiful reredos. Includes views of transepts, Lady Chapel, High Alter, ancient stained glass windows, sculptures, and the relics of the crypt.

results.title: Yokihi = Princess Yang Kwei Fei
results.creator_credit: Kenji Mizoguchi, Masaichi Nagata, Run Run Shaw, Daiei Motion Picture Company and Shaw Brothers
results.brief_description:
The Chinese Emperor Genso of the Tang Dynast marries a beautiful scullery maid on the death of his wife, with whom he falls in love. The new empress is destroyed by jealousies and intrigue around her as a popular revolt rises against the couple. This film uses an exquisite colour range with costumes and decor to relay the characters’ emotional turmoil. A film about political intrigue and corruption in 8th century China, ‘Princess Yang Kwei Fei’ depicts the dying stages of a dynasty. In the film’s final scenes the Emperor, who has survived the uprising but is old and unhappy, is mystically reunited with his deceased wife.

Credits: Producer, Masaichi Nagata, Run Run Shaw ; director, Kenji Mizoguchi ; writer, Yoda Yoshikata, Matsutaro Kawaguchi, Masashige Narusawa, Tao Jin ; photography, Kohei Sugiyama ; music, Hayasaka Fumio.
Cast: Machiko Kyo, Masayuki Mori, So Yamamura, Eitaro Ozawa, Eitaro Shindo, Haruko Sugimura.

results.title: Yoke Heng's story
results.creator_credit: Brian Salt and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with Singapore’s social welfare services. Tells the story of Yoke Heng, a sixteen-year-old boy from crowded Chinatown show cares for his five brothers and sisters while both his parents are in hospital. The hospital almoner is able to help the family secure one of the modern flats being erected on the outskirts of the city. On the parents’ recovery, the family is reunited in their new home.

results.title: Yoga for health
results.creator_credit: A. Bhaskar Rao, M. Bhavnani and Ministry of Information and Broadcasting
results.brief_description: An introduction to the ancient science of Yoga. Yoga is the disciplining of all human powers - physical, metal, moral and spiritual. Then aim is not only bodily strength but health, stamina and mental awareness - qualities that people need whether at work or play. This documentary shows some Asanas which, if practised, can serve as a foundation of good health.

results.title: Yoga and the individual
results.creator_credit: John B Murray and John B Murray Productions
results.brief_description: Introduces Yoga as taught in Australia, briefly discussing its background in Indian thought. Vijayadev Yogendra and Jill Yogendra demonstrate the special exercises of the physical system, and their relation to the system of meditation is briefly explained.

results.title: Yesterday, today: the Netsilik eskimo
results.creator_credit: Gilles Blais, Marc Beaudet and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Until the mid-1960s Zachary Itimignac and his family lived the nomadic life of the Inuit hunter in the Pelly Bay region of the Arctic. Then the Canadian government introduced measures to provide heated dwellings, a school, a hospital, medical care, a cooperative, air transportation, etc. This film is a day-long study of the impact of the changed way of life on this one family.

results.title: Yesterday's witness: the first boy scouts
results.creator_credit: Tim Byford, Stephen Peet and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Three of the Brownsea Island boys, who accompanied Baden-Powell on the first camp in 1907, recall the first days of scounting. lady Baden-Powell talks about her life with Lord Baden-Powell. Also considers the social context of scouting, and its state of development.

results.title: Yesterday
results.creator_credit: Conrad Standish, Gordon White and Gordon White and Associates
results.brief_description: A young boy of the 1670’s wanders through the Swan Hill Pioneer Settlement and views some characteristic features of life there in the past. Residents of the Settlement in period costume, an old steamboat - the Pyap - journeying down the Murray River, horse-drawn coaches, and colonial buildings, all contribute to this picture of yesterday’s Swan Hill. Accompanied by instrumental folk music.

results.title: Yes, Virginia, there is a Santa Claus
results.creator_credit: Bill Melendez, Tom Keegan, Mort Green and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description: The story of eight-year-old Virginia O’Hanlon who tries every source to find out if there really is a Santa Claus and finally writes to the editor of the New York Sun for her answer. Suitable for primary level.
